answers.text:
Hi Kathleen,
Thank you for your question on improving community appearance. ICMA has a few articles that discuss measurable outcomes from community appearance improvement efforts that may be of use to you. 
•   “Police and Code Enforcement Collaboration” is an article about Aurora, CO and their efforts to use police and community appearance improvement strategies to reduce crime in certain neighborhoods. They found that their program was successful and that the external appearance of a neighborhood and the level of crime are linked. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/1808
•   The City of Durham has used Computerized Neighborhood Environment Tracking (ComNET) to clean up the appearance of their neighborhoods and improve city-citizen relationships. Citizens report nuisances with handheld computers with digital cameras to report issues to the local government and then the government takes care of these issues. This has resulted in a much improved appearance of the City. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/100178
•   “The True Value of Code Enforcement in a Community” is an article that discusses how code enforcement can be a driver of change in a community. You may find this article to be a good starting point for your research. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/305014/The_True_Value_of_Code_Enforcement_in_a_Community
I hope these articles are helpful! Any other ICMA members please add your comments and advice!
Best, 
Robin Saywitz
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Kathleen Margoles
text: Do you have measurable Community Appearance Outcomes for Code Enforcement.   We are embarking on a new program to improve community appearance on major arterials and in neighborhoods and need outcomes.
title: Measurable Community Appearance Outcomes
